attributes.action: Allow victims of Child Sexual Abuse the location of their Offenders release
attributes.background: The man who abused me has been released from prison. I am still not allowed to know where he is located. A high-profile sex offender who destroyed my life. I should have the right to know where he is to minimise the risk to myself and my family.
attributes.additional_details:
Clare’s Law: The Domestic Violence Scheme, that offers members of the public the right to ask the police if their partner may pose a risk to them. 
Sarah’s Law: The Sex Offender Disclosure Scheme, that allows anyone to formally ask the police if someone with access to a child has a record for child sexual offences. 

He is on licence conditions to not come near my home, so he was released information of my vicinity. Victims should be allowed this information about their offender, especially when the offender is allowed to know where their victim lives.

attributes.action: Revoke Northern Rail's Charter for disability access failures
attributes.background: Northern Rail fail in their commitments to the Equality Act by treating disabled customers less favourably than non-disabled customers.
attributes.additional_details:
They allow you to book scooter/ramp assistance and then deny access to the train when the customer arrives. This can be intimidating and humiliating them at times.

Northern Rail’s policy is outdated and their treatment of disabled people is unacceptable. The Equality Act 2010 was introduced to help ensure businesses treat everyone fairly. It protects anyone who is disabled, is thought to be disabled, or is with someone who is disabled. It gives these people rights to access goods or services in a way that means they are not treated less favourably than people without a disability

attributes.action: Make paying rent enough proof that you are able to meet mortgage repayments!
attributes.background:
Me and my husband are hoping to buy a house! Which is going to be a difficult process! 
We have been renting for 3+ years 
Never once defaulted on our rent payments we have paid around £20000 in rent payments! Why is this not considered when apply for a mortgage!
attributes.additional_details: they still solely look at your income! When on paper you are paying a high figure for rent each month, which would indicate you are able to meet a payment for your own home!

attributes.action: Stop the use of Juvenile Covert Human Intelligence Sources (child spies).
attributes.background: Currently Juvenile CHIS (child spies) can be used to gather information to do with offences such as gang violence, drug offences and child sexual exploitation. They can be authorised for covert activity for up to one month which the government is trying to increase to 4 months.
attributes.additional_details: The Home office has given no numbers of how many child spies are used, how the risk assessments are carried out and whether the handlers are trained to assess juvenile mental health. The capacity for children to consent to being spies is dubious given they must feel under pressure from an authority figure (the police force) and are vulnerable in a dangerous situation. Refer to 35th Report of Session 2017-2019 of the House of Lords Secondary Legislation Scrutiny Committee.

attributes.action: Do not raise fuel duty in the Budget
attributes.background: The Chancellor has indicated he is considering raising fuel duty in the 2018 Autumn Budget. RAC Fuel Watch data shows fuel prices are at their highest for four years with drivers paying £7 more per fill-up on average than 12 months ago and £15 more than in 2016.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has the highest duty rate for diesel and the eighth highest for unleaded in the EU. Further increases would put UK drivers and businesses at a bigger disadvantage compared to our European counterparts. Motorists already contribute around £46bn in motoring related taxation each year and higher fuel prices mean the Treasury is already benefiting from extra VAT receipts on fuel costs. 

The Treasury’s own analysis in 2014 showed that lower fuel duty actually boosts economic growth which in turn yields higher revenues from other tax receipts over a long-term period.

We believe the Chancellor risks pushing further economic hardship on motorists for what is an essential item for over 40 million drivers and therefore we call on Philip Hammond to abandon any plans to raise fuel duty.

attributes.action: Grant President Donald Trump a full State Visit
attributes.background:
Following President Trump's recent successful visit to our country, the next step should be to allow him the privilege of a full State Visit.

President Trump is the democratically elected President	& as such should be treated with the respect his position holds
attributes.additional_details: We the people of the UK request that President Trump is invited to the UK, given a full state visit, he should also be given the honour of addressing Parliament and the people of the UK.

attributes.action: Get Student Finance England to consider a mortgage as ‘financial independence’.
attributes.background: Currently, the regulations for an individual applying for Student Finance under the age of 25, must be assessed on their parental household income, unless married or care for a child. However, SFE do not view a mortgage to be an eligble factor to verify “independent status”.
attributes.additional_details: After several appeals to review my circumstances, SFE have rejected my request for “independent status”. As a home-owner, unemployment with little student loan to pay my mortgage for the year whilst studying, has resulted in withdrawal from my course. It is suggested to marry to be considered as “financially independent” to therefore receive finance based on my own income rather than my parents. It is an outdated system to consider marriage as more financially independent, than owning a home.

attributes.action: Set a legal minimum requirement for hamster cages
attributes.background: RSPCA recommend that a Syrian Hamster should have a cage with 80 x 50cm unbroken floor space. However this is not defined in law so pet shops can sell 50 x 60cm cages as LARGE hamster cages. Your small pets live stressed and unhappy lives, while you think you’ve bought a sufficient cage.
attributes.additional_details: Parliament should change the law so that it specifically includes this minimum cage size for hamsters. This would make it an offence to sell and use cages for hamsters which don’t meet this size.

attributes.action: Place ‘not all disabilities and illnesses are visible’ signs on disabled toilets
attributes.background: Those living with unseen disabilities and invisible illnesses can need; and have the right to use, disabled toilet facilities. Yet current signage is not inclusive, overlooks and marginalises those who need to use them, but have no outward or visible indicators of their needs.
attributes.additional_details: The current signage on disabled toilets does not represent our current understanding of hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses; by updating signage on all pre-existing, and all new build disabled toilets we can improve the quality of life for thousands of people around the U.K.  By adding this new signage alongside the pre-existing wheelchair emblem, we both include those living with hidden disabilities and invisible illnesses, and promote equality of toilet access across wider society.

attributes.action: Make it a legal requirement for all schools to be accessible to disabilities
attributes.background: We want there to be an introduction of legislation which mandates all UK schools to be fully accessible.This will include setting out national guidelines for schools to follow, taking the responsibility away from the local authorities ensures there will be consistency in the levels of accessibility.
attributes.additional_details:
Our hope is that one day, disabilities will no longer be a barrier to living life to the full. People with disabilities should never face discrimination and should never be excluded from buildings or activities because of a lack of access.

In a recent report by the Children's Commissioner Sally Holland, it was discovered that 4 out of 22 councils did not have their strategies in place even though they are required to do so by law, and the government have not updated their guidance since 2004!

attributes.action: Review current policy allowing councils to turn off street lights at night.
attributes.background:
As police numbers fall and crime rates rise it is causing a feeling of insecurity amongst local communities as many councils turn off ALL ‘non essential’ street lights. 
We feel that street lights are needed for the well being of our community

attributes.action: Issue a termination notice to Bright Tribe and ALAT multi-academy trusts.
attributes.background: On the 10th of September BBC Panarama aired its findings following investigations into the set up and running of Bright Tribe and ALAT multiacademy Trust’s. Prior to this staff, parents and pupils have highlighted questionable use of related party transactions.
attributes.additional_details: Questions have been raised in the Education Select Committee relating to their conduct. They have already been removed from Whitehaven Academy.

attributes.action: Amend the law and reclassify the meaning of 'intentionally homeless'.
attributes.background: At present, under the law, tenants who are served 'notice' are encouraged by their local council to remain in their home; for, if they leave, they are bizarrely classified as 'intentionally homeless' and are unlikely to be housed as a priority.
attributes.additional_details: Conventional wisdom would say that if a tenant is served notice by a landlord, then they must leave. However, local councils are increasingly encouraging tenants to remain until a landlord is able to obtain a County Court Judgement in which bailiffs forcibly remove a tenant as this is the only way a tenant can qualify for long-term rehousing under the current law. This is cost prohibitive to both tenants and landlords and must be changed- being served 'notice' is not an act of intentional homelessness

attributes.action: Put young offenders in prison for knife crime
attributes.background: The law for sentencing needs to be updated. People convicted of crimes involving knives should go to prison no matter what their age. They should not be allowed out on the streets if found guilty.
attributes.additional_details: There was a case recently where the defendant was under 18 and pleaded guilty to stabbing someone. There was also video evidence that the defendant had broken his court bail conditions. He just got reminded of his bail conditions - nothing else. He wasn’t sentenced to prison, even though he could have killed someone.

attributes.action: Hold an independent inquiry Health Service settlements
attributes.background: It has been reported that Virgin Care were handed almost £2 million in an out of court settlement by Surrey’s Clinical Commissioning Groups, NHS England and Surrey County Council in 2017. This is a gross misuse of public money, but no-one has resigned or been held accountable.
attributes.additional_details: Lessons deserve to be learnt from such losses of public money.

attributes.action: Seek to extend the A50 period so that there can be a better deal/final vote
attributes.background: The government is making a hash of the Brexit negotiations and needs more time to agree the deal or allow the public a vote on what Brexit could look like in practice.

attributes.action: UK Government to be responsible for planning that affects historic environment
attributes.background: Local councils do not have the necessary expertise to make planning decisions when the historic environment is at stake. The UK Government should take back responsibility for these decisions from local councils, to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites.
attributes.additional_details: The NPPF fails to protect the integrity of historical and cultural sites. Planners lack the wisdom to appreciate them. These problems are far-reaching and threaten the destruction of our historic environment as well as the squandering of tax payers’ money.

attributes.action: Phase out current mental healthcare model and implement the Open Dialogue model.
attributes.background:
Over the next five years:
- Replace open wards with Open Dialogue.
- Reform compulsory detention under the Mental Health Act 1998 in order to fit this method of treatment, as fit.
- Train all mental health staff in Open Dialogue.
- Double MH services that come to the patient’s home “on-call”
attributes.additional_details:
One of the other key point of the Open Dialogue model is it debunks the life-long medication method as it has been proven to be more effective. This should also be reflected in changes in relevant laws.

Changing the mental health act would involve only detaining patients who have broken the law and creating hostels for homeless patients

This investment would ultimately save the taxpayer a lot of money.

Below is a documentary on Open Dialogue:

https://youtu.be/HDVhZHJagfQ

attributes.action: UK Government should urge India to stop mob lynching and crime against women.
attributes.background: UK Government should ask India to stop mob lynching and stop crime against women in India and take action against Saffron Terrorists who are killing minorities including Muslims and Christians.
attributes.additional_details:
UK Government should ask United Nations Commission on Human Rights to take notice of what is happening in India.

86% of those killed in cow-related violence since 2010 are Muslim, 97% attacks after Modi govt came to power-https://m.hindustantimes.com/india-news/86-killed-in-cow-related-violence-since-2010-are-muslims-97-attacks-after-modi-govt-came-to-power/story-w9CYOksvgk9joGSSaXgp”

attributes.action: Immediate shut down of oil or gas wells that are cold venting methane gas.
attributes.background: Some UK wells are operating under old style permits which allow them to 'cold' vent methane to the atmosphere if capture or combustion and flaring is technically or economically not viable. Methane is a powerful greenhouse gas and venting is inconsistent with the UK's climate change commitments.
attributes.additional_details: We call for production at these wells to be immediately stopped until they can be adapted to no longer require the use of permitted methane release points.

attributes.action: Make The Disability Symbol For Parking/Toilets Inclusive Of Hidden Disability
attributes.background:
Does the government feel that only wheelchair users are classed as disabled when 93% diagnosed with a hidden dissability are blue badge holders?
We propose a change of the current disabled symbol to the universal symbol of a blue circle as an adjustment to reduce prejudice discrimination and stigma
attributes.additional_details:
Most blue badge holders without obvious physical impairment who have parked in wheelchair symbol spaces have experienced animosity and prejudice by members of the public who judge them to be fraudulently taking up the space of 'disabled people' 
As a representative of the charity Epilepsy Sucks UK and mother of a son diagnosed with a severe form of epilepsy and autism who is a blue badge holder I have experienced this myself. 
I urge all with hidden disabilities to sign and state your diagnosis.

attributes.action: Ban all gambling advertising on TV
attributes.background: Problem gambling cost this country up to 1.2 billion pounds per year according to official figures. It is also linked to mental health and homelessness. Along with smoking gambling adverts do not belong on the television. Many gambling adverts promote it as glamorous - this is highly irresponsible.

attributes.action: Workplace Stress&mental health training made mandatory for all managers
attributes.background: Since 2012 work related stress, anxiety & depression has increased from 10.4 million to 12.5 million days lost. Employee, work related mental ill health is taking it's toll on workplaces, but also effecting people's home lives, more often than not alcohol and substance misuse problems, & suicide.
attributes.additional_details: HSEAW states  "Employers have a legal duty to protect employees from stress at work by doing a risk assessment and acting on it." However, as a company who specialise in corporate Mental Health and Workplace Wellbeing programmes the vast majority of organisations we come across are not complying with legislation as legislation is not being enforced, stress Ps & Ps are not in place & managers, HR and H&S have had no training to aid in prevention & appropriate management of these risks.

attributes.action: Male Suicide Prevention Strategy
attributes.background: According to the ONS, "of the 5,965 suicides registered in 2016, a total of 4,508 were male and 1,457 were female." We call on HM Government to take urgent and meaningful action to identify main factors that contribute to men in the UK being three times more likely to commit suicide than women.
attributes.additional_details:
We call on the PM to establish a panel on Male Suicide Prevention, whose job would be to undertake public consultation and produce a comprehensive report on male suicide in the UK; with key findings and recommendations leading to the publication of the Government's first ever UK-wide Male Suicide Prevention Strategy.

"The fall in suicide rates from 2015 to 2016 is the largest decrease in 20 years. It fell for both males and females in the UK, although men still account for 3/4 of all suicides."

attributes.action: Allow the rules of intestacy to be challenged when evidence allows
attributes.background: Allow the rules of intestacy to be challenged where there is evidence that the deceased wishes for their estate to be distributed another way
attributes.additional_details: The rules of intestacy are severely outdated and do not allow for the complex families we have nowadays. They allow for people to inherit when this isn't what the deceased would have wanted or when all evidence points to another method of distribution. The rules should not be as black and white as they are at present.There should be an allowance for people to challenge the rules when necessary.

attributes.action: Change the law for protection for Police Service Animals
attributes.background: The current MAXIMUM sentence for injuring a Police Service Animal is 6 months, but it is usually just a fine. Help to change the Animal Welfare Act 2006 to carry a heavier sentence and to take all Police Service Animals into consideration.

attributes.action: Change adultery for grounds of divorce to apply to same-sex affairs
attributes.background: According to current UK law, you cannot divorce someone on grounds of adultery if it's a same-sex affair. This technically means that you don't legally commit adultery if you cheat on your partner with someone of the same sex- even if you are in a same-sex marriage. This needs to change.
attributes.additional_details: In order for heterosexual and homosexual couples to have completely equal rights, the UK law needs to change urgently.

attributes.action: Allow parents to claim carers allowance for more than one child who receive DLA
attributes.background: I am a mother of 2 disabled children. They both are in reciept of high rate DLA and mobility. Therefore I claim carers allowance of £64.60 a week which is way below the national minimum wage. One of my children has various complex medical neeeds and is a full on 24/7 365 days a week nursing role.
attributes.additional_details: As parents and full time carers to our children, most of us can not work due to the complex nature of our children’s medical needs. Therefore I am calling on our government to enable us full time parent carers of more than one disabled child to be able to claim the £64.60 per week for each of our children who are in receipt of DLA and not just one.

attributes.action: Ban Animal circuses in the UK. It is animal cruelty and completely barbaric.
attributes.background: I am tired of seeing endless videos and stories all over the internet and news of animals being killed or showing signs of such unnatural distress simply for our entertainment. As humans and as a community it is our duty to keep moving forward from senseless, unnecessary and straight up callous acts

attributes.action: Provide funding for Amputee Football in the UK.
attributes.background: The England Amputee Football Association's aim is to provide all amputees, people with congenital limb deficiencies and persons with restricted use of limbs, with the opportunity to play football locally, nationally and internationally. However, players must raise funds to cover the costs of this.
attributes.additional_details: Amputee football is a fascinating sport to watch. My husband, Darren has been an amputee for 10 years and by being part of a team of amazing and inspirational people, as well as the volunteers who provide physio and coaching, means that he can respresent his country playing the sport that he’s always loved. All players must fundraise and donate to the charity in order to be able to participate in training and tournaments. This sport has the potential to be one of the best in the UK.

attributes.action: Emancipation Day Bank Holiday.... First Monday in August
attributes.background: The emancipation of slavery which took place in August 1833 is celebrated across different parts of the world. Britain, who played a big part in the slave trade, but,consequently played its’ part in the emancipation of slavery has never recognised this day as an important event in our history.
attributes.additional_details:
The slave trade lasted for centuries and resulted in millions of people losing their lives. A vast amount losing their lives in horrific circumstances. Britain made vast amount of money during the slave trade and many establishments in Britain was built on the back of it.
The emancipation has left us with great people that have played a major part in the human rights campaign such as Nelson Mandela, Dr  Martin Luther King, Rosa Parks. But we also have to remember that these people wouldn’t have the voice to speak if it wasn’t for emancipation.
By having Emancipation day as a bank holiday it will make the people of  Britain more aware and understand our past history.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to cut grass verges at night-time as it kills nocturnal wildlife
attributes.background: The Council have started to cut grass verges at night-time. This is disastrous for nocturnal wildlife eg hedgehog's, vole's etc as they come out onto the grass verges to feed and travel and are too slow to avoid the mower blades. These animals need protecting and it should be done during the day.

attributes.action: Add ethnic groups Gypsies, Roma and Irish Travellers to the NHS data dictionary
attributes.background:
Gypsies, Roma and Irish Travellers are ethnic groups with some of the lowest health outcomes in the UK.

At present, these groups are not recorded in the NHS data dictionary. Inclusion in the NHS data dictionary would give a clearer idea to authorities on how to tackle these health inequalities.
attributes.additional_details:
Gypsies and Travellers have a life expectancy of over 10% less than the general population (10-12 years). Other health issues include such as high infant mortality rates, high maternal mortality rates are also seen to be prevalent in the Gypsy and Traveller communities. 

Furthermore, the European Commission sees similar health inequalities with Roma; “a high prevalence of diabetes, cardiovascular disease...obesity, asthma and mental health issues such as stress, anxiety and depression”

attributes.action: Make flu jabs free for teachers
attributes.background: Flu jabs are free for a range of different people, teachers come into contact with a large number of people including children and parents. Schools often have flu outbreaks and teachers end up having to take time off due to sickness. This could be prevented if flu jabs were provided.

attributes.action: Fund research and treatment for Neurofibromatosis tumours
attributes.background: It was announced at NF Conference that over half of the patients in the Selumetinib trial saw significant reduction in tumour size of their inoperable plexiform neurofibromas. http://www.ctf.org/news/selumetinib-granted-orphan-drug-designation-by-the-fda-for-nf1 Seeing is believing
attributes.additional_details: My daughter has one in her neck that can’t be removed but has almost killed her a few times and they are others out there. If the result was same in adults, it would save NHS on hospital operations and even hospital stays. There are not enough doctors in UK that know enough about the disorder. We’ve lost friends due to NF and I don’t want my daughter to be just another number. She’s scared it will kill her. She has nightmares.

attributes.action: For schools to sing the national anthem
attributes.background: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country values and traditions. I grew up hearing the song -shows great respect to our queen and monarchy. I feel there have been debates about this - I personally would not like the song to lose it's importance for our Country, Queen - God
attributes.additional_details: I believe the national anthem is a important part of our country it mentions our god - our queen and shows the world the importance of the  monarchy and the great respect we have for our country traditions and the queen and our fellow men and women who have lost their lifes for our country.This song holds a important place in England's traditions being sing at football and commonwealth games and like other countries we should sing our national anthem with pride - many share my views.

attributes.action: We call for a total ban of all alcohol and tobacco based products in the UK
attributes.background:
There is a substantial body of scientific and medical evidence to show that legalized drugs, primarily as alcohol and tobacco, are harmful and can damage people’s mental and physical health, and our wider communities.

We call for the government to ban these harmful substances.
attributes.additional_details:
We believe that the legalization of Alcohol and Tobacco send the wrong message to the vast majority of people who do not take drugs, especially the young and vulnerable, and leads to widespread misuse of these drugs.

These drugs are extremely harmful to individuals and communities, and should be banned, especially as they are significantly more harmful than already illegal drugs such as Cannabis.

http://www.thelancet.com/journals/lancet/article/PIIS0140-6736%2807%2960464-4/fulltext

attributes.action: Promote plant-based lifestyles
attributes.background: We now know we are 12 years away from climate catastrophe. And that the single biggest thing we can do to reduce our impact on the Earth is to eliminate animal products from our diet. Yet any talk of the government encouraging us to adopt a vegan diet is swept aside as ‘nanny-stateism.’
attributes.additional_details:
Animal products are everywhere and not just in our food. If the public have any hope of achieving a plant-based lifestyle they need state help. The government needs to:
 
• Make menus in public institutions entirely vegan 
• Tax any product that contains animal products 
• Stop giving incentives to people who farm animals 
• Incentivise those who grow or produce vegan foods 
• Educate the public about plant-based living
 
For the future of our planet this subject urgently needs debate in parliament.

attributes.action: Change the eligibility criteria of carers allowance.
attributes.background: I believe that someone who cares for someone else shouldn’t be denied by criteria from seeking other employment, studying or trying their best to continue living their lives.
attributes.additional_details: A person caring for a disabled person 35+hrs a week can apply for carers allowance (CA) provided you meet certain criteria. You can’t be under 16.  A 2010 BBC survey estimated 700k young carers who though they may care for 35hrs+ a week aren’t entitled to CA.  You can’t be in full time education or study for 21hrs a week - if you attend school, college or Uni you aren’t entitled to CA.  You can’t earn more than £120 a week. & receive CA. The system ignores care outside normal working hours.

attributes.action: A short stay disability parking pass for people urgently needing toilet access
attributes.background: 100,000’s people in the UK have bowel or bladder condition which means they urgently have to use a toilet.  Sufferers often don’t make it to a toilet in time due to not being able to park in an accessible parking spot because they do not qualify for a disabled car parking badge.
attributes.additional_details:
Sufferers would only need to use the parking pass for the time when they urgently need a toilet.  They would then be able to move their vehicle to a standard parking spot.

Having a short stay pass for those times when they suddenly need access to a toilet would significantly improve the independence & quality of life for a person living with a long term bowel or bladder condition that affects their levels of continence.

attributes.action: Increase use of restorative justice for adult offenders
attributes.background: Restorative Justice gives the victim the chance to have a meeting with their offender. In order for the meeting to take place, all of the parties have to agree to participate. The meeting is assisted by a mediator, and the aim is to discuss the offence and its consequences as a group.
attributes.additional_details: Researches show that RJ satisfies 85% of the victims and reduces the re-offending rate by 14% [https://restorativejustice.org.uk/criminal-justice]. Young offenders are offered RJ where appropriate, but this does not occur enough for adult offenders. We would like the government to introduce legislation that makes it mandatory to offer RJ to adult offenders where appropriate. Please sign if you agree that this would be a positive move forward for victims, offenders and the Criminal Justice per se. #RJ4EVERYONE

attributes.action: Incentivise the use of the river Thames as a transport mode for freight
attributes.background:
Having operated vessels on the Thames, I am saddened by the surrounding decline of practical opportunities for utilising our glorious river sustainably for freight.

We must ask government to assess whether enough resource is available for industry to thrive and prefer water transport over road.
attributes.additional_details:
Today, yet again commuters using the M25 are stranded due to a HGV freight collision closing the QEII bridge.
Whilst this may seem unrelated, our small vessels pass underneath, with nearly no other vessels in site for miles.
A free, reliable transport mode able to move thousands of tonnes a day and relieve the neighbouring roads of HGV movements.
Why is more not being done to retain the use of the waterways?  Shipyards are in decline.  Skills are in decline.  We must act, before it is too late

attributes.action: Ban the sale of natural cotton bedding for small animals as it is highly unsafe.
attributes.background: Natural Cotton bedding has been the cause of at least 6 hamster deaths in the last 4 weeks that I personally know of. Deaths are caused by Entanglement and suffocation due to the fibres blocking access to the airways in the throat.  This is a priority issue amongst hamster owners.
attributes.additional_details: You can check hamster central forums and any face book hamster group for evidence and heart wrenching accounts from owners who have awoken to find their hamsters passed on due to entanglement or suffocation.  I have read two accounts of new owners struggling to try and save their hamsters from suffocating as the bedding had lodged in the throat, sadly they were unsuccessful.

attributes.action: Allow curry houses to bring in migrant staff for minimum UK wage
attributes.background: Curry business are penalised in the UK by an unrealistic salary threshold policy of £29750.00. Staff shortages in the industry means many business are closing down. UK should allow curry business bring knowledgeable staff from abroad for practical salaries to protect small businesses.
attributes.additional_details: It is not possible to train someone local in a short time to cook at a commercial standard. Imposing an affordable salary to recruit overseas trained staff helps curry business to stay in the market. To protect from illegal workers, govt. can introduce laws requiring compulsory full-time work, limited stay, and fixed amount deposit to ensure that illegal workers return before the end of their stay. Reducing illegal workers will make a large contribution to UK HM Revenue and tax.

attributes.action: Pledge 5% of the UK's annual GDP to halt climate change
attributes.background: By heavily investing in green technologies, research and infrastructure within the UK now, this government would assure the industrial sector for the UK would become the preeminent leader in all green technologies before the rest of the world inevitably takes similar measures.
attributes.additional_details: https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/science-environment-45084144

attributes.action: Question Cameron's decision to impose fundamental constitutional change
attributes.background: This nation is a representative democracy or at least it used to be. Then in 2016 David Cameron imposed a regime favoured by dictators and demagogues: decision by dint of a misinformed public–a referendum. An inquiry is needed to find out why he decided to impose fundamental constitutional change.
attributes.additional_details: Britain is in a political crisis brought about by the transfer of supreme authority from the electorate to the government. It is not true to say that the people decided to leave the EU, because that claim presumes that the electorate has followed the government's instruction that they must make the decision. For the government to instruct the electorate on how to vote & then instruct Parliament on how to interpret that vote is fundamentally undemocratic. Why was that instruction issued?

attributes.action: Undertake a thorough investigation into Northern (Rail) and their conduct
attributes.background:
Northern, in the views of many, fail to perform in almost every respect. 

Trains are regularly cancelled, delayed or don't have enough carriages. 

Their performance makes commuting and public transport in the north a misery and has huge implications on the economy and daily lives of millions.

attributes.action: Legalise cannabis for medicinal purposes
attributes.background:
Evidence has shown that the use of CBD products improve help in cancer patients, people who suffer from severe epilepsy’s, MS and Parkinson’s desease
It’s time for action

attributes.action: Make Dementia/Alzheimer's care completely funded by the NHS
attributes.background:
Full funding for the care of Alzheimer’s and Dementia patients should be covered by the NHS. Plenty of families face so many worries when a loved one goes into care and paying for their care shouldn’t be one of them. 
Please take a moment to sign my petition. 
Thank you.

attributes.action: Make It Law That Cyclists Have To Have Insurance
attributes.background: Cyclists can cause accidents just like other road users! They have very little patience towards people that they share both cycle and footpaths with. They should be insured!
